name: compute_equity_multiple
description: Calculate the Equity Multiple (also called Multiple on Invested Capital, MOIC) for a property or portfolio investment. Equity Multiple = Total Cash Inflows / Total Cash Outflows. A multiple > 1.0 means the investment returned more than was invested. Commonly used alongside IRR to assess absolute return magnitude.

cash_flows.description: Array of periodic cash flows (negative = outflows/investment, positive = inflows/distributions). Same vector used for IRR.

label.description: Optional label for the investment (e.g. property name, 'Portfolio', 'Management Company')

equity_multiple.description: Total inflows / total outflows (e.g. 2.1x means $2.10 returned per $1.00 invested)

total_invested.description: Sum of all negative cash flows (absolute value)

total_returned.description: Sum of all positive cash flows

profit_margin.description: Net profit / total invested as decimal (e.g. 1.10 = 110% profit)
